Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written policies
Description and procedures that prohibit the following forms of intervention:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on
any part of their body.
2

Allegation On 12/16/22, youth was sitting on the floor and had refused to get up.
Staff member was observed kicking youth multiple times. A bruise was
observed on youth's right arm and there is concern youth may develop
bruises on their back/side area as well.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
19, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
getting upset at school and running out of the building. Youth A stated
he ran around the building and tried to re-enter through double doors
where Teacher and Staff 2 met him. Youth A reported sitting on the
ground in the middle of the double doors. Youth A stated Staff 2 kicked
Youth A onetime in the right elbow. Youth A reported Staff 2 did not
say anything when Staff 2 kicked Youth A. Youth A stated Teacher
was standing close to Youth A and Staff 2 was standing to the side of
Youth A. Youth A denied other youth or staff witnessing the kick.
Youth A showed DHHS Worker and I a yellowish bruise on his right
inner elbow.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
19, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist denied
Youth A talking about this incident in therapy. Therapist stated Youth A
has been focused on moving to a different house. Therapist reported
Youth A being in a good spot for placement.
Teacher was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
19, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Teacher reported
Youth A left school and tried to come in the double doors of Holbrook
(main entrance to building). Teacher stated Youth A sat down on his
butt, against the wall in the middle of the double doors and began
kicking Staff 2. Teacher described Youth A swinging his arms toward
Staff 2 and screaming. Teacher reported the area in-between the
doors is very small, so Youth A, Staff 2 and Teacher were all close to
one another. Teacher denied Staff 2 kicked Youth A. Teacher stated
Staff 2 tried stepping back from Youth A but there was no room so Staff
2 would pivot at the waist to block Youth A from hitting Staff 2. Teacher
stated Staff 2 was asking Youth A what he needed but that was all Staff
2 was saying to Youth A. Teacher denied any youth being present.
Teacher stated Supervisor came to the doors, got Youth A, and went to
Supervisor’s office.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported examining
Youth A after the incident and seeing one bruise, multiple colors that
would have been there prior to the incident.
4

Supervisor/Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility
on December 19, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor/Complainant described being in an office, looking out the
window, and seeing Youth A exit the school without staff.
Supervisor/Complainant stated she stood up, headed to the front of the
building, and heard Staff 2 say lock Holbrook. Supervisor/Complainant
reported walking to the double doors when Staff 1 came out from
behind the check in counter saying, “he’s kicking him, he’s kicking him.”
Supervisor/Complainant described seeing the top of Youth A’s head,
Teacher standing in front of the right door, Staff 2 standing to the side
of Youth A, and Staff 2’s leg move up and back down. The double
doors are glass only on the top half of the door and a black metal
material on the lower half of the door, making it so you cannot see.
Supervisor/Complainant stated seeing Staff 2’s leg motion but did not
actually see Staff 2’s leg connect with Youth A.
Supervisor/Complainant reported seeing at least two kicks and heard
Youth A say, “he’s kicking me, he’s kicking me.”
Supervisor/Complainant reported she opened the door, told Staff 2 he
was released and brought Youth A to the office.
Supervisor/Complainant denied hearing Staff 2 say anything when she
approached the double doors or when she opened the door to get
Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described from her
area at the check in desk hearing Youth A scream, “you kicked me” to
Staff 2. Staff 1 reported Teacher, Staff 2, and Youth A were in-between
the double doors of the entrance into Holbrook. Staff 1 stated she saw
the back-and-forth motion and the top of Staff 2’s leg move more than
one time. Staff 1 stated she approached the double doors, but
Supervisor/Complainant had just arrived, so Staff 1 went back by the
check in desk. Staff 2 reported Supervisor/Complainant said something
to Staff 2, talked with Youth A and then brought Youth A to
Supervisor/Complainant’s office. Staff 1 stated she did not see the
impact of the kick, but Staff 2 seemed annoyed.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described Youth A
getting upset while in school, running out of the building and running to
the entrance of Holbrook. Staff 2 stated he met Youth A at the
entrance along with Teacher. Staff 2 reported Youth A fell to the
ground in-between the double doors and started hitting Staff 2 with his
arm. Staff 2 stated he pivoted to protect his groin area as that is where
Youth A was hitting Staff 2. Staff 2 described Youth A sitting on the
ground with his back against the wall with Staff 2 on Youth A’s left side.
Staff 2 stated after making the pivot motion, Youth A screamed “you
4

kicked me.” Staff 2 denied kicking or making any contact with Youth A.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor/Complainant opened the door and removed
Youth A. Staff 2 stated he believes Supervisor/Complainant thought
Staff 2 was kicking Youth A. Staff 2 reported his foot never left the
ground, that he pivoted from the waist to turn to avoid getting punched
by Youth A. Staff 2 stated the area was so small there was no way to
step back from Youth A swinging his arm.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on January 9, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B reported things are going
well at the facility and not having any concerns with staff or how staff
conduct restraints.
DHHS Worker has no findings in the investigation.
Tour Observation:
DHHS Worker, Staff 2 and I went to the double door entry to Holbrook.
DHHS Worker and Staff 2 stood in-between the double doors while I
stood outside of the doors. Staff 2 demonstrated the pivoting motion
that he described during the interview. I was unable to see Staff 2 from
the waist down while he was standing in-between the double doors.
The motion of Staff 2’s body could possibly look like a kicking motion.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was disciplinary action in 2022 for
a safety plan not being followed, 2012 pre-packaging medication
for a home pass and 2008 for improper restraint technique. Staff
2 completed the required Aegis training on 01/26/2022.
• Staff 2’s written statement to the facility regarding the incident
which was consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Youth A’s written statement regarding the incident which was
consistent with Youth A’s interview.
• Eagle Village Health Care Visit Report dated 12/16/2022 for
Youth A: “A light brown/black/green bruise was seen on his
anterior/lateral upper arm proximal to his elbow. The bruise was
circular and about the size of a quarter. He had soft tissue
tenderness and full ROM of his upper extremity.” This exam was
the same day of the incident.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Supervisor/Complainant and Staff
1 did not actually see Staff 2’s foot make contact with Youth A. A
person seeing Staff 2’s pivot motion from outside the double doors
could reasonably think Staff 2 was kicking Youth A. Interview with
Teacher and Staff 2 deny Staff 2 kicking Youth A. The bruise on Youth
A’s right arm was an older bruise and located on the arm opposite of
where Staff 2 was standing next to Youth A.
4

Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
January 12, 2023
